comm: that ball swung, Hazlewood delivered on a full length outside off from over the wicket, Guptill drove a little away from his body and got an inside edge on to the pad
good length pitching outside off and swinging away from Guptill, who wafts from his crease and misses
short of a length on the hips, nudged off the back foot behind square for a single
good length outside off with some seam and bounce, McCullum stays back and plays the ball to point
stays in his crease at a full ball angling into the right-hander, moved outside leg a little too, gets an inside edge on to the pad
a full ball on middle stump, looking for swing, the first four balls moved, the last two did not. McCullum plays it towards mid off
angles a length ball into the pads and Guptill turns it through square leg for a single
a full ball swings into the right-hander quite a bit, and swings right onto the middle of McCullum's bat, he pressed forward and lofted that over the bowler's head with a straight bat
there's the charge and slog, McCullum steps out of his crease and swings across the line, dragging the ball along the ground through midwicket
another full ball outside off stump, McCullum stays in his crease and tries to blast through the off side but mis-times the drive
hits the ball firmly but can't beat the fielder at point
a low full toss, Hastings is looking for swing but over-pitches, McCullum stays balanced on the front foot as he cover drives along the ground with perfect control
defended off the back foot towards point
a fuller ball on middle and leg, Guptill stays in his crease and pushes the ball towards mid-on
good length on off and middle, angling into the right-hander, McCullum stays back and defends with a straight bat to the bowler

that's a risky shot! McCullum backs way towards leg, and Hazlewood follows him with a delivery that seams into the right-hander. He is cramped for room but McCullum manages to cut it over the head of the fielder at first slip
not short enough to pull but McCullum does it anyway, he mis-times it but the ball falls outside the circle at square leg, too far away from the infielder
a full and straight ball, mis-times the drive to mid-on, Hazlewood has not given McCullum anything easy to hit
short of a length outside off, Guptill hits the ball off the back foot, hits it well but can't beat cover point
128 kph, drives away from his body at a length ball outside off, a bit of away movement, the outside edge flies down to third man
good length, angling into the right-hander, McCullum pushes forward and drives to long on
first six of the day, Guptill gets under a full ball on the front foot and drives cleanly over long off
cut hard but not in the gap at cover point
short cover dives to his right and saves three runs by deflecting a powerful drive towards mid off. Mitchell Marsh that was, awesome effort
stands back in his crease and works a short of a length ball towards square leg
short ball, Guptill swivels and pulls way too early, he gets hit on the shoulder
defended on the back foot on the leg side

Guptill is so lucky there, he's been tied down by Hazlewood and now tries to cut a good length ball that seams into him, cramping him for room. He gets a bottom edge that misses the stumps and goes down to fine leg for four
gets behind the line and defends from his crease
good length around off stump, no length or width to hit, Guptill drives at the ball and plays it to cover point
a full ball nearly in the blockhole from over the wicket, McCullum stays in his crease and keeps it out
tight length on a wicket to wicket line, McCullum defends on the leg side
pushed from the crease towards long on for a single, a really accurate start from Boland
good length, pitching outside off and angling in, Guptill defends with a straight bat
a slightly straighter ball on a good length, dabs the ball slowly towards mid-on and wins the race against Hastings, who rushes in and misses the stumps at the bowler's end
watch out in the tents! McCullum gets on the front foot because the length is full for once, and then he plays the lofted drive for a 90-metre hit over long off
against Guptill pulls way too early, the short ball comes off the pitch just a little slowly, Guptill gets a bottom edge into the pitch near his feet
good length just outside off, Guptill drives off the front foot to cover
driven into the covers again, not timed well
great length again outside off, Guptill punches off the back foot but can't find the gap at cover
now it is a bit too full and straight, allowing Guptill to move forward and across to drive the ball off his pads over the midwicket boundary
too short this time, Guptill does not play the pull too early this time, he nails it, swivelling and middling the shot for a one-bounce four to deep square leg
a full toss with some swing into the right-hander, McCullum does not over-hit it, he leans forward and drives it smoothly along the ground through the gap at cover
moves outside leg but the bowler follows him, McCullum plays the ball towards square leg
steps out of his crease this time and moves outside leg to make room and drive inside out over the wide long off boundary, that's his 199th six in ODIs
he's been beaten! McCullum moves outside leg and then tries to defend because the length is good, I think the ball passed between his outside edge and leg stump there!
defended from the crease on the off side
that's six number 200 in ODIs for McCullum! He steps out of his crease a long way and flicks a length ball off his pads high and far over deep square leg

that's a risky single and it's resulted in five for New Zealand. Guptill dropped the ball near his feet and said no right away, but McCullum was haring down for a single. No way he was going to run out his captain in his final ODI, so Guptill ran late, and ran hard. Wade rushed to the ball and threw at the bowler's end. Zampa was slow to back up from mid-on. Guptill is huffing and puffing, he really sprinted to make his ground
defended from the crease towards point
driven firmly to long off for a single
good length outside off, Guptill meets it on the front foot with a clean drive to mid off
short ball, and Guptill has adjusted the timing of his pull shot now, he waits a bit and then swivels and smashes it to the square leg boundary
good length just outside off, dropped with soft hands wide of the keeper on the off side for a single
good length outside off, Guptill pushes forward to defend and the ball goes off the outside edge towards point where the fielder fumbles to allow the single, Khawaja that was

McCullum's final innings is over! And he gets a massive cheer from the Seddon Park crowd, they are rising to their feet to clap off their captain. That went high in the air and Hastings caught it superbly. McCullum had charged and slogged but ended up slicing the ball high in the air over the bowler's head. It was surely Maxwell's catch? He only had to move a little to his right from mid-off. But Hastings had moved quickly to the ball from mid-on and at the last moment he took a look at Maxwell, who was not going for the catch, so Hastings stuck out his large hands and the ball dropped in
good length and straight, Guptill defends
defended from the crease
defended into the off side
short of a length outside off, Williamson stays back and cuts to point
Maxwell dives to his left at point to block a firm Williamson cut and keep him on zero
too short, too wide, Maxwell won't get close to this, Williamson moves back and across and cuts the ball superbly into the gap at point
gets behind the line of a good length ball and defends
moves back and across to flick a short of a length ball off his hips through square leg
moves forward and towards the off side to steer the ball to third man
moves forward and across to turn a length ball off his pads through square leg
good length around the off stump, stays in his crease and drives to long off
great length just around off stump, Williamson moves forward and across to play the ball towards point
tucked off the back foot through square leg
short of a length and down leg side, Guptill moves back to glance but misses it, the ball brushes his thigh though and goes past the keeper for four leg byes
defended back to the bowler
a full ball outside off, Australia bowling that line wide to Williamson again, cutting off the leg side, driven off the front foot to point
stays in his crease and dabs a good length ball to third man
good length with a little width outside off, Guptill goes back to slap the ball towards cover but can't beat the fielder
defended off the front foot into the covers
defended on the front foot once again
defended from the crease on the leg side
pushed off the front foot towards mid on
steps out to take the ball on the full and drives to long on
slightly short and zippy outside off, Guptill goes back and square drives through point
Williamson waits in his crease for the flat ball to spin a little away from him and punches to long off
that's a long hop and Guptill frees those long arms, rocking back and pulling the ball far over deep midwicket
a fuller ball on off stump, Guptill drives off the front foot through cover
a length ball on middle and leg, whipped off the pads behind square
full ball outside off, driven off the front foot towards cover
short of a length and slower wide outside off, the batsman lets it go. That's a tight call, Williamson had moved towards the off side
good length around off, punched off the back foot towards mid off
really wide outside off, far outside the tram line, Williamson for some reason lunged for it, swiping rather ungainly, he got an edge that bounced before the keeper, imagine had that carried!
the real Williamson moves smoothly across his crease and flicks the good length ball neatly off his hips through square leg
punched off the front foot to mid off
steps forward and then goes back to dab the quicker straight one behind point
gets down on one knee and sweeps behind square
punched off the back foot through cover point for two more
that's a bit short but the pace is skiddy and rushes Guptill into the pull off the back foot, he mis-times it to midwicket
gets on the front foot to drive a flighted, slower ball to cover
driven on the front foot to cover, Zampa is drawing Guptill out with his flight and length
Boland returns with a length ball around off, Williamson moves across his crease to tuck the ball towards square leg
Guptill brings up his half-century by driving a length ball hard into the ground, it bounces over the fielder at cover. 51 off 50 balls, and I cannot believe an IPL team did not pick him up
worked off the back foot towards midwicket
punched on the up off the back foot to long off
gets beaten by a good length ball that pitches outside off and seams away from Williamson's forward defence to pass the outside edge
played through square leg for a single
a tossed up ball on middle stump, driven off the front foot to long on
slightly shorter with some dip outside off, Guptill plays it into the covers
the flatter and quicker ball, at off and middle stump, Guptill drives to long off
steps out of his crease and defends to the bowler
shorter and wider, giving Williamson room to cut the legbreak through point
strides forward to a good length ball to defend the legbreak on the off side, Zampa bowling really well to Guptill, who is a bit hesitant against him
good length angling in towards off and middle at 135 kph, Williamson gets behind the line and defends to mid on

bowled him! Williamson has been tied down by the line Australia have been bowling to him, they have been outside off stump on a good length most of the time, cutting off his leg side. Now Williamson gets a slightly wide one but the length is good outside off, he reaches to cut the ball without moving his feet - he usually moves back and across so smoothly - and bottom edges on to his stumps. That ball actually seamed into the right-hander to hit the bottom edge
stays back and tucks a length ball off his hips in front of square leg
good length outside off, Guptill defends
shot! Short of a length with width outside off, Guptill meets it with a back-foot punch through cover, standing tall in his crease, he beats the diving Bailey to his right on the boundary
played towards point for a single
a full ball outside off, driven on the front foot to long off
the legbreak pitches off and middle and spins into the left-hander from over the wicket, Nicholls goes back and defends
a full toss floated wide outside off, Nicholls drives off the front foot to long off
gets on the front foot and defends towards the bowler

Zampa has troubled Guptill today and now he's got him! He drifted the legbreak to pitch outside leg stump and Guptill was always in trouble trying to sweep that without clearing his front foot, he had to reach for that and was in an awkward position - cramped for room - to play it, he ended up top edging tamely to short fine leg, where Hastings took an easy catch
drives a low full toss to wide mid off
nudged off the front foot to long on for a single
drifts down leg side, Elliott tries to sweep and is also cramped for room by the line and length, the ball beats the bat and the keeper
nice drift, says Wade. Good length outside off, driven into the covers
worked off the pads through square leg for a hard-run two, he came forward to play that
defended towards mid-on off the front foot
goes back and nudges the ball uppishly towards midwicket
moves forward and pushes a ball from off stump towards cover

that's in the air but just wide of Smith diving to his left at short midwicket! Nicholls went back to a legbreak and chipped it uppishly, would have been such a soft dismissal had he hit it two feet closer to the fielder
nudged to midwicket but an overthrow allows the second
a full ball outside off, Elliott stays in his crease and drives through cover
the legbreak, slightly shorter, Nicholls goes back to pull but can't get it past midwicket
gets down low to play the paddle sweep towards fine leg
driven back to the bowler off the front foot
tucked off the pads through square leg for a single
steps out and drives the flighted ball to long on
defended on the front foot towards cover
goes back and plays the ball to midwicket
another mis-field at point, Marsh lets the cut go through his legs after moving to his left, Maxwell is unhappy
nudged off the pads towards fine leg
defended on the front foot on the off side
driven to long off for a single
gets on the front foot to defend the leg break
gets down on one knee to sweep but Marsh makes a good save at square leg
nudged off the front foot into the covers, another fumble
moves forward to meet a flighted legbreak with a smooth push down the ground to long off
drives a full ball, forcefully off the front foot, beats extra cover to his right, not mid-off to his left
played towards mid-on
goes back and cuts a flatter ball outside off through point
driven off the front foot to point
leans forward and drives back to the bowler
steps out and drives past the non-striker to long on
tight line and length just outside off, pushed off the front foot to point
moves forward and across to sweep the legbreak from just outside off to deep square leg
defended on the front foot on the off side
gets on the front foot and reaches out for a flighted ball outside off to chip it over the infield at cover

short ball, pulled and dropped at square leg! That was such a long hop, should have been six really, but Nicholls' pull - though hard - was not high enough and flew straight at Marsh just over his head, it burst through his hands
played to point off teh front foot
played into the covers off the front foot
good length just outside off, punched towards mid off on the front foot
chases a fuller ball with a cover drive away from his body and gets beaten by a fuller ball that slants across the left-hander

moves forward and across to drive a full ball towards extra cover, where Marsh dives to his left and deflects the ball towards Warner's left at mid-off, and Warner was moving to his right to back up Marsh, so New Zealand get an extra run because Warner has to stop, turn and chase
cut towards point
driven firmly into the covers, Marsh makes a sharp stop diving to his left
played back towards the bowler on the front foot
strides forward to reach a flighted legbreak and pushes into the cover. "He's coming down, can feel it mate," chirps Wade.
driven off the front foot through point for a single
he's nailed that sweep! Moving forward and across, getting down low and hitting the ball out of the middle behind square leg
punched off the back foot to long on
pushed off the front foot towards long on
turned off the pads on the front foot through square leg for a single
142 kph, good length on off and middle, pushed with soft hands to mid-on and they sprint a single
good length just outside off, played off the back foot towards point

make that four! Nicholls steps forward and plays a loose drive away from his body at a good length ball outside off, Smith is waiting at first slip. A really loose shot and another soft dismissal. New Zealand in danger of being derailed again after a strong start
good length outside off, Anderson lets it go
good length just outside off, Anderson stays back and defends
more tight bowling just outside off stump, pushed off the front foot to backward  point
driven off the front foot just wide of the diving Maxwell at midwicket towards long on
played off the back foot towards the bowler, Zampa moves to his left and fields
that's the googly, pitching on middle and spinning across Anderson, who moves back and defends
the legbreak now, Anderson stays back and hits it off his pads through square leg
tossed up outside off, driven off the front foot to cover
good length, pitching outside off and angling away from the left-hander, there's a slip in place too. Very similar to the ball Nicholls chased and edged. Anderson shoulders arms
a fuller ball outside off, Anderson stays on his crease and cuts, thick-edging the ball along the ground to third man
tight line on a good length, close to off sump, Elliott stays in his crease and runs the ball to third man
played from the crease towards mid off
good length outside off, Anderson lets it go again
good length once again just outside off, Anderson drives to mid off
strides forward to defend the flighted legbreak on the off side
goes back to cut the flatter ball but can't get past point. "Big risk coming here boys," says Wade
tucked off the pads towards square leg
Anderson goes back to one that slides across him and plays it to point
dragged a bit short outside off, Anderson moves back and a bit towards leg to hit the ball in front of point

goes back and towards the off to dab the ball late past short third man, Hastings chases, Zampa's spell is over - he's bowled really well on a small ground, dragged down the scoring rate and dismissed Guptill. think they hit only one boundary off him
a length ball with width outside off, the Hairy Javelin meets it on the front foot and drives through cover point
pushes forward and opens the face to steer the ball to third man

what a shot that is! A length ball with width outside off, Anderson plants his foot forward and drives through the line and on the up, smashing the ball over long off. There's a slip in place so Australia might not mind him attempting such shots

Dropped, a low chance at short cover! Anderson drove the ball firmly and low, hitting the ball off the bottom of the bat, the ball flew quickly but straight to Khawala, who stooped to get both hands to it but could not hold on. Anderson has broken his bat and needs a new one. Are you starting the car, Nick?
driven with more care, towards point
steered towards third man for a single
tries to turn a good length ball towards square but the angle away from the left-hander results in an outside edge towards the off side
moves back and across to the off side to dab the ball gently towards cover, Anderson wants one but Elliott says no quickly
moves forward and across and dabs the length ball to third man
a fuller and straighter ball, Anderson pushes at the ball from the crease and plays it through midwicket
Elliott tries to cut a good length ball that pitches outside off and nips into the right-hander, he's beaten
steered off the back foot to third man
short of a length outside off, Elliott stays in his crease and cuts in front of point
defended from the crease into the covers
steps out and slogs at a good length ball, he was aiming for midwicket but hit it to mid on
Warner had to move quickly to his left and dive to cut off that fierce front-foot drive from Anderson, drilled with so much power
stays back and defends a good length ball coming into him from around the wicket
swivels to pull a short of a length ball angling down leg side, Anderson misses and Wade dives to his right to try and stop the ball, he gets glove on it and deflects it to fine leg, time for drinks
defended towards point
driven off the front foot into the covers
a full ball angling across the right-hander from over the wicket, Anderson drives off the front foot to long off
driven off the front foot towards cover and New Zealand get to 200
presses forward and opens the face late to steer the ball towards third man, where Khawaja fumbles again
a fuller ball outside off, Anderson lets it go
good length on off and middle, defended with a straight bat
short of a length outside off, played towards cover point with soft hands, Maxwell swoops on the ball and misses at the bowler's end, Elliott was safe though
angles the ball into the left-hander from around the wicket, cramping him for room, he stays back and plays to point
good length, pitching outside off and angling in, stays in his crease and plays to point again
dabbed behind point this time for a single to third man
moves back into his crease and turns the ball off the pads behind square, only three overs the over, NZ need to be getting about 5 here on though for a few overs
good length, angling into the right-hander from over the wicket, Elliott calls for two after tucking the ball off his pads through square leg, Anderson sensibly stops him at one

the slower short ball and Anderson is beaten because he pulls too early, there's a half-hearted appeal for caught behind from Wade because there is a definite noise as the ball passes the batsman, it clipped the back of the helmet!
driven hard off the front foot but Zampa is in the way at cover
this time Khawaja does well by covering good ground from third man to prevent Anderson's firm cut off the back foot from reaching the backward point boudnary
defended on the back foot on the leg side
stays back and cuts the ball to third man, right to Khawaja this time
short ball and Anderson moves towards the off side and swivel-pulls  through square leg, not timed well, played too early because the ball gripped the pitch and did not come on
tries to biff the short of a length ball hard through the off side but mis-times it to the bowler

Anderson steps out of his crease and outside leg, making room to try and free his arms, Boland follows him with a skiddy fuller ball, cramping him for room, Anderson jams his bat down at the ball but is beaten, the ball misses leg stump
the pull is mis-timed along the ground to deep midwicket
there's no fielder at long on so Elliott steps out and lofts the fuller ball flat towards that boundary
Maxwell mis-fields the ball at point to allow the single this time
Elliott makes room by moving outside leg and cuts a length ball off his sumps in front of point
played towards mid off
good length outside off, Anderson can't get the ball past point with his cut
stays back and waits for the ball from around the wicket to angle into him to steer it to third man

pulled in the air and towards deep square leg, Bailey sprints in from the boundary and dives forward at full length, he doesn't get to the ball and it drops just before his hands, Bailey still manages to get it cleanly and prevent it from bouncing past him
played to mid off for a quick single
good length angling across Anderson from over the wicket, the left-hander dabs the ball close on the off side and runs
moves back and outside leg, Hazlewood follows him to deny Elliott room, Elliott adjusts and clips through square leg

Anderson has picked out Khawaja at long on! He stepped out to clear the straight boundary and was cramped for room a little by the line angling into him from around the wicket. He timed the shot well because it travelled really quickly to Khawaja, but he did not hit it high enough. Khawaja moved to his left to catch it
a full toss down leg side, Wade dives to his left to collect
good length outside off, pushed off the front foot towards point for a single
that full ball swings into the right-hander, so nearly in the blockhole, Elliott tries to flick and was lucky to inside edge it on to his pad
a low full toss outside off, Elliott moves outside leg and plays towards cover, is there some reverse swing out there?
a full and straight ball, driven straight between the stumps and the non striker
short and wide outside off, cut so hard off the back foot, in the air but just short of Bailey who dives to his right at point to save the boundary
moves back and dabs the ball off the back foot behind point for a single
good length on off and middle, driven from the crease between midwicket and mid on
tight line on off stump, stays back in his crease and defends on the off side
there's no one on the long off boundary and Elliott clears it to bring up his fifty! Got on the front foot, got under the half volley, and swung hard

a huge appeal for lbw as Hazlewood swings a full ball sharply into the right-hander. The umpire says not-out and Australia review immediately. That looks so close! Ronchi was forward, jamming the bat down late, as he was struck flush on his toe by the ball swinging into the blockhole. That's going on to smash the stumps but he was struck a fraction outside the line of off stump. He survives by the skin of his teeth
played to mid off on the front foot
another full toss, Hazlewood looking for that reverse swing, Ronchi hits it to long on, did not time it
Elliott backs away far outside leg, exposing all three stumps to hit inside out through the off side, gets beaten by a slower ball that bounces just wide of off stump
a full ball down leg side, Wade dives to his left to make the save, the batsman seemed to have missed that but the umpire does not call it wide
driven on the front foot to mid off

Ronchi's struggles continue, he's mis-timed this one straight to long-on, where Boland takes an easy catch. The length was good and the line angling into middle stump, Ronchi swung across the line and mis-timed it completely

two in two for Marsh, what a series he is having! Maxwell runs in from the deep square leg boundary and dives to take the catch. The ball was dipping sharply as he caught it. Elliott had got down on one knee outside off to play a slog-sweep of sorts, he timed it well but hit it in the air and not high or far enough
the hat-trick ball is driven on the front foot through cover point
moves back and across to tuck the ball off his hips through square leg
the bouncer high and wide outside off, the batsman tries to upper cut and misses
a full ball on the pads, flicked off his toes wide of fine leg for four
good length outside off, defended on the front foot towards cover
good length angling into the right-hander, a solid defence on the front foot
a full ball angling into Bracewell, who leans forward and across to drive past midwicket
strays down leg side again, the batsman tries to flick but the ball is too far away

an appeal for lbw and he has been given this time! Milne has a word with Bracewell and is walking off. That was missing leg stump surely? The full ball swung sharply into the right-hander and hit the boot before ricocheting on to the bat. He should have reviewed that, it was sliding past leg stump.
this ball is swinging sharply now, Henry flicks it to one of two men at midwicket
full and straight, driven back to the bowler
Henry stays in his crease and defends the swinging ball towards midwicket
Hastings hits the pad with a slower ball from over the wicket as the batsman moves across his stumps to flick, that was missing leg

bowled him! Bracewell is bowled between bat and pad as he moves forward to drive at a good length slower ball that swings into him a fair bit. Hastings hits middle and leg stump. Australia have got the ball hooping in the last few overs. New Zealand in danger of being bowled out with so many overs to go

and it's all over! Hastings ends the innings with 27 balls to go! He bowls a swinging yorker at the No. 11 Sodhi, who jams his bat down on it. He manages to get some bat on it but not enough to prevent the ball from squeaking through and rolling on to his stumps
good length with some away movement from Henry from over the wicket, Khawaja chases it with a loose drive, crease bound and away from his body, he's beaten
beaten again, this time he stays in his crease and tries to cut at a good length ball close to off stump
136 kph, good length just outside off, left alone by the batsman
a cracking drive! Moves forward to a fuller ball outside off and splits the small gap between two fielders at point with superb timing
good length on off stump, defended on the front foot
a full ball on middle stump, Khawaja moves forward and across and flicks the ball to midwicket
full and wide outside off, Warner reaches for it and mis-times the drive to cover
138 kph, short of a length delivery slants across Warner before moving into him, forcing him into a hurried defence on the back foot
a full ball around off, driven to wide mid-off for a single
Khawaja leans forward and square drives behind point for a single
good length around off stump, defended from the crease towards cover point
a fuller ball outside off, driven off the front foot into the covers
139 kph, good length around off, Khawaja stays in his crease and pushes into the covers
short ball, Warner pulls with his front leg off the ground, hopping across his crease and pulling behind square
stays back and dabs the ball towards cover point for a quick single
141 kph, Khawaja is timing it like a dream, leaning forward and picking out the gap between extra cover and mid off with a smooth drive
so classy! Khawaja presses forward and hits the ball on the up with the angle across him from over the wicket, cover-driving to perfection
jumps back and across to tuck the length ball from a leg and middle stump line through square leg
steered off the back foot towards third man for a single
good length just outside off, Warner stays in his crease and drives the ball wide of mid off for a single
short ball, Khawaja swivels in his crease and pulls to the man at deep square leg
Warner backs away outside leg to make room against the angle into him from around the wicket, and then he flays at the length ball, carving it over point for a boundary
poor line when the fielder at fine leg is in the circle, Warner jumps back and tucks the ball off his hips to the long leg boundary
good length outside off, pushed off the back foot towards point

Williamson has pulled off a spectacular catch, one of the best you will ever see, but he has gone over the boundary and so it is a six! Khawaja stepped out and slogged the ball towards long off, he mis-hit it actually. Williamson ran all the way back from mid off at brisk speed, keeping his eye on the ball as it dropped over his head, and dived to take the catch, problem for him was that when he landed he was already over the rope.
steered to third man off the front foot
played from the crease on the off side
guided towards third man for a single
driven down the ground for one more

he's been caught at cover! the ball was nothing special, short of a length and angling into him, Warner was on the back foot to punch over cover but the ball stopped on him a bit and he ended up spooning it straight to Elliott
drives away from his body at a full ball and bottom edges it towards first slip, gets to the fielder on the bounce
good length on off stump, Khawaja gets behind the line and defends from his crease
149 kph, Khawaja presses forward and tries to cut a good length ball through cover point, he went hard at the ball and bottom edged it into the ground near his feet
short of a length with width outside off, Khawaja is on the back foot as his bat comes down in a flash and he cuts the ball behind point
Smith tries to force the ball through covers with a punch off the back foot but the ball nips into him and goes to the leg side off the inside edge
banged in short and the batsman is beaten on the hook, a fast bouncer
good length on a wicket to wicket line, defended on the back foot
a fuller ball outside off, driven on the front foot to mid off
Smith moves back and across to defend a good length ball towards midwicket
an inside edge on to the pad as Smith tries to defend from his crease, that ball seamed into him from just outside off
defended on the back foot towards the bowler
Smith gets behind the line of a good length ball on off and middle stump and defends to play out a maiden over
jumps back and opens the face and steers the ball behind point
Smith moves back and across to punch towards extra cover and they run a single before McCullum can prevent it from mid off
147kph, pitches on a good length around off, bounces and seams away from the left-hander, Khawaja stays back and opens the face to play to third man but is beaten
Khawaja moves forward to defend and takes one hand off the handle as he does so, that ball nipped back into the left-hander after slanting across him
the bouncer that climbs on the left-hander, Khawaja moves into a good poistion and then turns his head away as he hooks, he hit it well enough to clear the long leg boundary
that was just a gentle push from the crease at a fuller ball but Khawaja is timing it so well that mid-off has no chance once it passes him
driven firmly off the front foot but straight to McCullum at mid-off
Smith moves back and across to whip the length ball from off stump to deep square leg
that's edged wide of the fielder at first slip, Smith was on the back foot as he drove at a good length ball outside off that held its line
moves forward this time and defends on the leg side
just a gentle push off the front foot through extra cover but the timing is great, Williamson chases down the ball from mid-off
gets behind the line of a good length ball and defends
Smith moves back and across to a length ball and works it from off stump through square leg
stays back to a good length ball that angles into him and bends away a little, plays to point with an open face
that's flicked in the air but just wide and over the sub fielder at mid-on, Munro it was and he gives chase
another cracking shot from Khawaja, moving back and pulling a ball that is not that short, hit all along the ground to deep square leg
worked off the hips through midwicket for a single
a full ball on off stump, a bit of swing away from the left-hander, Khawaja presses forward and drives to cover point
a length ball just outside off, Smith has time to move across in his crease and tuck the ball with the angle into him through square leg
driven off the front foot behind point for a single
moves back and across to open the face and steer the ball to third man this time
poor line, outside leg stump, easy pickings for Khawaja who stays back and glances to the fine leg boundary
stays back and moves slightly towards the off side to get close to the ball that angles across him and steer to third man
139 kph, the bouncer outside off stump, Smith moves back and across before letting it go
good length angling across the left-hander, Khawaja stays back and plays the ball on the off side

caught behind! Khawaja stays on his crease with feet rather stationary and drives loosely away from his body at a length ball that seams away from him, a thick edge and Ronchi dives to his left to take the catch, rather like how Nicholls got out
gets behind the line of a good length ball and defends
a full ball angling into the right-hander, leans across on the front foot and flicks through square leg
good length just outside off, defended on the front foot
moves back and right across to defend a good length ball from right in front of his stumps
bowled on a good length around off, defended on the front foot
Bailey moves forward, out of his crease and then has to adjust to the flatter ball and swat on the leg side
defended on the front foot
draws Bailey forward with his flight and there's turn away from the right-hander as Bailey moves forward to defend
the googly dragged short, Bailey goes back and pulls to deep square leg
pushed off the front foot towards cover point
Smith moves deep in his crease and towards the off side to pull the short of a length ball towards long leg
good length on a tight line, Bailey moves back and across to block
a good length ball with some nip into the right-hander, Bailey defends on the front foot towards cover, 136 kph
Bracewell sticks out his left hand on his follow through and fields to stop Bailey's firm front-foot drive
pushes forward and defends a good length ball towards point
a full ball with some movement into the right-hander, driven back to the bowler
tossed up outside off, Smith meets it on the front foot with the drive
tossed up again outside off, driven on the front foot to cover
bowled flatter and shorter, the ball spins away from Smith who moves back and a little towards leg to drive the ball through point
Bailey lunges forward and opens the face to play the ball in front of point
shorter ball, Smith goes back and pulls to deep square leg
tossed up outside off, driven on the front foot to long on
good length just outside off, defended on the back foot
Bailey faces up to Bracewell with that unusual stance of his, almost facing mid-off rather than the bowler square on, he then moves across his crease and flicks the ball over square leg
the bouncer is too high and Bailey lets it go
good length on off and middle, defended from the crease towards mid on
stays in his crease and defends a good length ball on the off side
played into the covers
Bracewell keeps it tight on a good length just outside off, defended on the front foot
driven off the front foot but the flighted ball goes off the thick edge towards point
played off the back foot to point this time
tossed up outside off, the batsman lets it go as it spins sharply away from him
leans forward to get to the pitch of the ball on off stump and defends with a straight bat
dragged down a bit too short, Smith goes back and pulls to deep square
driven off the front foot, not timed well to mid off, just 12 runs off the last six overs
moves back and across and works the ball off his hips through square leg
shot! Too full on the pads, Bailey leans forward and across and flicks the ball in the air and over wide mid-on to the boundary
good length on off and middle, Bailey lean across again and defends towards the bowler
pushed back to the bowler off the front foot
dabbed off the back foot towards point for a single
defended on the front foot on the off side, times for a drinks break
steps out to a legbreak and pushes it to cover
tossed up with width outside off, Bailey frees his arms on the front foot and drives to long off
nice flight but a bit too full, Smith moves forward and drives to the bowler

lbw! Smith does not like the decision and he is going to have a word with Bailey. They are reviewing this one. Smith was a long way on the front foot, down on one knee as he tried to sweep that ball. There was no edge and that ball is going straight on to hit the stumps
stays back and defends the legbreak to the bowler
Sodhi has broken open this game! Maxwell pushes with hard hands away from his body at a legbreak pitched on a good length outside off, thick outside edge caught by McCullum at first slip
stays in his crease and defends towards the leg side
good length on off stump, defended back to the bowler
pushed off the front foot back to the bowler
stays in his crease and plays the ball to point
a fuller ball on middle and leg, flicked off the pads through midwicket
good length with bounce from off stump, the batsman stays in his crease and defends
tossed up outside off, too full and too wide, Bailey cover drives off the front foot past McCullum at short cover and to the boundary
driven on the front foot to long off for a single
defended on the front foot to the bowler
gets on the front foot and opens the face to play the legbreak to point
tossed up outside off, a low full toss, driven to long off
tossed up outside off, driven hard but McCullum gets a hand on it at cover, the crowd thinks its a catch but it isn't, was driven into the ground
tries to force the back foot drive through the off side but ends up playing it back to the bower, Bracewell's line and length is immaculate
punched off the front foot through cover for a single
driven on the front foot into the covers, good length just outside off again
jumps back and tucks the short of a length ball through midwicket
gets on the front foot to a good length ball at 135 kph and defends with a straight bat
short of a length outside off, Marsh tries to punch through point but gets a thick edge that takes it behind point
too much width outside off, Marsh gets on the front foot and nails the cover drive, hitting it really hard
pushed into the covers for a quick single
short ball, Bailey swivels and pulls behind square
driven on the front foot through cover for one more
that's the googly, it is defended on the front foot
the legbreak, bowled flatter and shorter, punched to long off
a full ball on middle and leg, clipped off the pads through square leg
pitches on a good length just outside off and nips into the right-hander, played from the crease towards midwicket
moves back and across and turns the ball behind square for a single
good length on off and middle, defended on the front foot to the bowler
gets behind the line on the back foot and defends
stays back and knocks a length ball towards long on
punched off the front foot towards cover
edged but the ball is slower outside off and so it falls well short of the wicketkeeper
nudged from the crease towards midwicket for a single
short ball slanting down leg side, the batsman pulls but misses
good length angling into the right-hander, played back to the bowler
hits the pads with a 136kph delivery, a full ball angling into the pads, skidding in, Marsh was looking to play towards square leg, that would have missed the stumps though
driven off the front foot to deep cover
a good length ball on middle and leg, driven to long on for a single
turned off the pads behind square for a single
shot! Marsh waits for the slower legcutter, stands on his crease and drives powerfully to the cover boundary

how well is Marsh timing it? Cover-driven to the deep where Nicholls runs to his right from deep point and picks it up just before going over the rope, then he jumps back to pick it up before the ball rolls on to the rope again, but his foot was touching the boundary
pushed into the covers for a single
a slower ball on the off side, played towards point for a single
he misses the flick but they will get a leg bye close on the leg side
short of a length outside off, steered to third man
an appeal for lbw after a 140kph delivery hits the pads, but it was full and heading down leg side
good length and straight, the batsman stays back and tries to pull but bottom edges on to the pitch
a length ball outside off, driven to mid off for a single
Bailey jumps back and across to nudge a short of a length ball off his thigh to the fine leg boundary
a full ball outside off, 138 kph, Marsh plays a thumping drive off the front foot, but hits it straight to mid off
the ball just flies off Marsh's bat, this square cut has raced to deep point
driven off the front foot into the covers
chipped in the air but it falls short of Milne at mid on
leans forward to a fuller ball outside off and pushes it towards point
a full ball angling into the right-hander, dabbed towards mid on and they run a single this time to Milne
Sodhi comes back with a superb legbreak - flight, drift, dip on to middle stump and turn past the outside edge of the batsman's prodding bat
pushed off the front foot towards point
spin and bounce from leg stump line, the batsman takes one hand off the bat as he defends on the front foot
pushed off the front foot to covers
bowled full outside off, driven on the front foot to long off
defended on the back foot towards the bowler
a length ball outside off, the batsman waits and cuts behind point for a single
incredible power! Marsh steps out of his crease and pulls a short of a length ball far over wide long on, it cleared the stands and went into a room!
deep cover has no chance! Marsh is using Henry's pace here, moving forward and driving a length ball through the line with a lot of power
driven into the ground and the ball bounces over the bowler's head

bowled him! Marsh has been hitting it like a dream but Bailey pokes tentatively at a short of a length ball that nips into him from outside off and gets an inside edge on to his stumps. Is there life in this New Zealand defence? 50 wickets for Henry at an average of 22. He's got there in his 23rd game, behind only Ajantha Mendis
driven off the front foot to mid off
a length ball outside off, square driven from the crease firmly though point
the slower ball on middle stump, driven to long on for a single
a length ball from around the wicket, Wade moves forward and drives to long off
cut off the back foot to point
Marsh stays in his crease and punches to long off, "bowled TS, bowled TS [Elliot]," says Ronchi
Wade stays in his crease and square drives through point
Wade tries to force the ball on the off side but gets an inside edge on to the leg side
Wade stays in his crease and turns the ball on the leg side

a huge appeal for lbw, not out says the umpire. Did that pitch outside leg? Wade moved across his crease to flick a good length ball from over the wicket and missed. It was crashing into the stumps but it pitched two inches outside leg. New Zealand do not review
plays the ball on to the leg side
Wade stays back and defends a good length ball on the off side
Wade moves forward to a fuller ball and drives crisply through cover
driven off the front foot through cover point for a single
punched to long on for a single
driven firmly off the front foot but to the fielder at cover
Wade waits a touch longer to push the ball into the gap between point and cover
good length on middle, pushed fro the crease towards mid on

pushed from the crease into the covers, no chance Australia will drop behind the D/L par score without a wicket falling. Though this rain everyone says is lose by hasn't arrived yet. Let's hope it does not.
good length just outside off, Marsh stays in his crease and pushes the slower ball - 124 kph - into the covers
driven cleanly off the front foot to cover again
stays back and opens the face to steer the good length ball to point

Henry thinks that ball has come straight off the boot and back to him, he half appeals for a catch. And that should be enough for an appeal and now the umpires are talking to each other. Henry bowled one right in the blockhole and Marsh jammed his bat down on it. I think that was hit into the ground and the boot. But Henry thought it was right off the boot and after ages the umpires decide to go to the third umpire. And would you believe it, that has gone right off the inside edge right on to the toe of the boot and back to Henry, who got down low in his follow through to take the catch, Marsh is out and Seddon Park explodes in a huge cheer. What a stroke of luck for New Zealand.
Henry bowls one into the blockhole, Hastings keeps it out
punched off the back foot through cover
gets down low to sweep and takes the ball from outside off and plays it behind square
good length on middle and off, defended on the front foot
tight line and length, gets on the front foot and blocks
defended on the front foot
Hastings moves forward and blocks the ball into the off side
pushed back to the bowler off the back foot
good length on a wicket to wicket line, defended from the crease on the leg side
forced off the front foot through midwicket, mis-timed the shot
short of a length outside off, Hastings moves back and opens the face to steer the ball behind point
driven firmly down the ground and Williamson races after it and slides to prevent the boundary
driven on the front foot into the covers
a full and slower ball, tries to push and gets beaten
played back to the bowler on the front foot
goes deep into his crease and plays the ball to long on
gets down low and paddles the ball to short fine leg
strides forward and defends on the off side
driven to long off for a single
goes back to pull the short ball, the bounce gets a bit big on him but Wade picks out the gap at cow corner
short of a length outside off, the batsman sways out of the line and lets it go
short of a length over off stump, Hastings leans back and tries to chip down to third man, gets beaten
and again, Hastings sways back and tries to cut the ball to third man, he is cramped for room by the short of a length ball and beaten
banged in short again, a bouncer this time, Hastings ducks under it
good length angling into the right-hander, Hastings gets behind the line and blocks
jumps back and dabs the short of a length ball to third man

the Hairy Javelin has caught it at deep square leg, running in from the boundary! Anderson peppered Hastings with another bouncer, it got big on him as he tried to hook, dragging the ball against the angle across him from over the wicket, the top edge was never going to clear the boundary and Elliott ran it and judged it well enough. New Zealand edge ahead in the chase!
clipped off the pads behind square for a single

edged and caught ... not just short of first slip! Zampa drove away from his body at a full ball slanting away from him from over the wicket, McCullum dives to his left at first slip but the ball falls just short
defended back to the bowler
good length on a wicket to wicket line, Zampa gets behind ti and blocks
too full to cut, no room outside off, he is beaten
a full ball on leg stump, leans across his stumps and clips the ball through midwicket
a length ball just outside off, Zampa stays in his crease and drives through cover, a push really
driven off the front foot towards mid off
145 kph, short of a length and rapid, Zampa chips it in the air off the hips through square leg
a full toss just outside off, Wade drives off the front foot but can't find the gap at cover

short ball, pulled straight at Guptill on the edge of the circle at midwicket! Actually that was not straight at him, he had to take a few quick steps to his left and dive to catch it. Wade hit that firmly but placed it i the vicinity of one of the most agile catchers in the game
opens the face and drives to point, the fielder dives to his left and stops it
back away outside leg to flay at a full ball outside off and misses, gave the bowler a clear view of the stumps
defended from the crease into the covers
Zampa clears his front foot and slogs at one that slants across him, he is beaten

edged and this time McCullum dives forward at first slip to catch it close to the ground! Zampa pushes from his crease away from his body at a good length ball that seams across him, the last time it fell short to McCullum's left, this time he dives forward to catch it before the ball can hit the grass!
defended from the crease on the leg side
Hazlewood backs away a touch and tries to chip a short of a length ball slanting across him over the slips, he is beaten
there's his first run in ODIs! Hazlewood stays in his crease and cuts a short of a length ball behind point
banged in short, Boland ducks under it
a nice cut shot off the back foot, a length ball outside off that was
backs away to a short of a length ball and fishes outside off, he is beaten

a full ball outside off, Hazlewood drives from his crease and away from his body, there's no slip in place now and the edge goes to the third man boundary. Doubt that would have carried to slip though
a fuller length just outside off, played on the off side from the crease
stays back and swipes at a good length ball slanting across the off stump, Boland is beaten
beaten once again outside off stump, Boland stayed in his crease and tried to cut
a length ball just outside off, Boland stays back and cuts to the fielder at point
opens the face late to steer the ball past first slip to third man
short ball outside off, backs away and tries to cut but is beaten by the bounce
Milne gives Boland a bouncer and the batsman ducks under it
how on earth has that missed the stumps? So close that was. Milne bowled a back of he hand slower ball in the blockhole and just outside off, Boland tried to dig it out and was beaten
the slower ball followed by a fast bouncer at 146kph, Boland ducks in a hurry

that's the game! A direct hit from point has run out Boland and the Kiwis rush towards Nicholls the fielder at point! Boland backed away towards leg to steer the ball towards point and ran, Nicholls moved quickly to his right, fielded cleanly and nailed the stumps with a swift throw, Boland was a couple of feet short
